channel.title: Microbusiness News Briefs Podcast
channel.description: The smartest ten minutes in small business podcasting.

item.title: MNB 02/05/07: Micros on the International Stage
item.description: As I mentioned earlier, I spent most of last week in Spain (or en route to Spain), where I delivered the keynote address to the eighth annual Escala Mikros Congress in Bilbao. The conference is all about microbusinesses - their...

item.title: Jet lag reigns supreme
item.description: Greetings! Having returned from my trip abroad over the weekend (of which you'll hear more later), I'm just a little behind here. So, I deeply regret that the MNB Podcast will be a tad late this week. I do expect...

item.title: MNB 01/29/07: Bush Floats an Almost-Good Health Care Plan
item.description: Well, President Bush got to make a bit of history with the first-ever State of the Union speech that began with the words Madam Speaker -- a fact that he graciously pointed out as soon as he took the podium...

item.title: MNB 01/22/07: Lawmakers Spat Over Small Business Tax Cuts
item.description: I suppose it's possible that there's just something in the air that makes people serving in Congress slowly lose their minds, but I doubt it. And maybe the fault could lie in House Democrats trying to score rhetorical brownie points...

item.title: MNB 01/15/07: Velazquez Starts Out With A Steady Hand
item.description: A lot of people seemed to think that the Democrats would surge into Washington at the start of the 110th Congress, frothing at the mouth and starting fights with President Bush just because they're Democrats and he's ... well ......

item.title: MNB 01/08/07: Net Neutrality Win Rings In New Year
item.description: Happy New Year! The new Democratic congressional majority has gotten itself off to a cheerful, energetic and noisy start, with much promised activity and much promised bipartisanship. As to that, we'll see. There are a few matters coming down the...

item.title: MNB 12/18/06: Credit Card Use by Micros Was Up in 2005
item.description: Since Congress is in recess and pretty much all is quiet on the policy front, this seems like a good week to check out some new research. We cover two Advocacy reports this week, one with more information on microbusiness financing and one on small business contributions to urban economic development.

item.title: MNB 12/11/06: Small Business Tortoises Beat Hares
item.description: About the only thing to say about the research released by Advocacy that is the subject of this week's lead article is, "Wow!" These findings are a major big deal for micros. Plus final moves on both the House and Senate sides of the Small Business Committees just before final adjournment of the 109th Congress. R.I.P.

item.title: MNB 12/04/06: Micros and Credit Cards, Mixed Blessing
item.description: We're back to microbusinesses and access to capital this week, with a story on market research conducted by various folks in the microenterprise development field on the entry of banks into the micro-credit market.

item.title: MNB 11/27/06: Small Business Finances Survey Released
item.description: It's mostly about money this week, with our lead story on the release (finally!) of the latest Federal Reserve Board Survey of Small Business Finances. There's also a relevant piece this week about microenterprise development, and microfinance, in the U.S.

item.title: MNB 11/20/06: Kerry Outlines Senate Panel Agenda
item.description: We head into Thanksgiving week with a report of a thankful-sounding Senator John Kerry outlining his agenda as the newly appointed Chairman of the Senate Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship in the 110th Congress.

item.title: MNB 11/13/06: New Gizmos, Old Issues in the Next 'Tech-ade'
item.description: Election week was last week and an interesting time was had by all. Of course, while the rest of the media's eyes were all fixed on the ballot box, your trusty microbusiness reporter was preoccupied with the duel matters of...

item.title: MNB 11/06/06: FTC Welcomes The Micro Perspective
item.description: A couple of months ago, I was complaining in The MicroEnterprise Journal about the FTC's 'Protecting Consumers in the Next Tech-ade' hearings because the voice of microbusinesses was likely to be absent from the proceedings. Well, now, I've been invited to participate.

item.title: MNB 10/30/06: Small Business Policy in a Democratic House
item.description: What would this midterm season be without a bit of a preview of what will become of the House Small Business Committee under Nydia Velazquez? Especially since current Chairman Don Manzullo brought the subject up by distributing a press release last week that was scarifying enough to be a worthy segue into Halloween week?

item.title: MNB Podcast Special: An Interview with Senator Blanche Lincoln
item.description: We're launching a new project here at The MicroEnterprise Journal, to conduct interviews with members of the Senate who are also members of Generation Jones: born between 1954 and 1965 and mistakenly called Boomers for most of our lives. We begin with Senator Blanche Lincoln, Democrat of Arkansas, on the issue of rural development.
